title: Thanks for Caring About Me
content:
as you paint yourself New York and climb the ESB
like Queen Kong all the way up to your office
where you will work all day like a mad woman
trying to get shit down on the second to last day
before your holiday next week. it is now a week
since you left and since I've seen you last–
my golden whore of the decade who I fill with cum–
and I picture you climbing the stairs all the way
to the roof for a Sleepless in Seattle moment
which for us would not exactly be filled with serendipity
and love but slutty dirty violet sex while you are hanging
off the edge of the ESB and I am driving my dick in you
from behind and gripping your hair from the back
which would be the only thing preventing you from falling
over the side of the railing and nakedly plummeting
all the way down to fifth avenue to a horrendous death
in front of all those fucking hot ass styled up NYC pedestrians
even though half of me does want to let go of your hair.
thanks for caring about me halfway across the world
encouraging me to literally take care of my heart
which is something I keep putting off off of but I promise
I will tomorrow and if I don't well I'll make you another
promise that when I die early next year you can have it
you can have my heart specifically because I won't need it
and at that point hopefully you'll have remembered
to give me the organ donor card you got me months ago
and when they give it to you encased in a mason jar
I hope you stick it on the mantle in the living room
of the new flat that you're going to buy with your husband
so you can remember the sick organ from where this poem
originated as I let go of your hair and watch you tumble
and mouth the words I love you watch my shrinking face.

title: In the Morning I Drink
content:
a cup of coffee and eat a bowl of overnight oats with granola
and then I sit down in the fucking chair and open my head.
I have no idea what is going to come into out and I have no idea
what is going to come out of it but I let it come as I was being pushed
and pulled by water, as if I were a water wheel or a bucket
at the end of a rope dangled deep inside a well. sometimes something
concrete comes pouring out onto the page like the residue on the nail
of a thumb that is leftover after you peel off a bandaid and the sticky
shit dries. sometimes something liquid comes pouring out like a cloud
or this intangible relationship that I have employed for almost a year
now. in the corner the snake plant is growing but sometimes I can't see
its growth. I just wake up one day and notice that one of its branches
has gotten taller than the third shelf on the bookshelf and there is a new
sprout rising up almost of the brim of its pot. this is how writing is
sometimes it takes so long to notice any growth and you just have to wait
and be the pot in which there is soil and a plant and you just have to contain
it all and let it grow as fast or slow or tall or short as it wants to but
you have to contain it. other times I am not the pot but the sprout
that must push itself up out of the dirt and those are the times I have to
sit down and write because a poem is coming out whether I like it
or not.

title: Diary of a Programmer 51: Applying for Slobs
content:
every day I get on the LinkedIn and look for jobs.
it is because I am unhappy sitting in my fucking chair
in the corner of my flat typing stupid poems into my work
laptop while I sip a cup of coffee with oatmilk and listen
to the traffic whoosh by and I wish that I was whooshing
by here or there or anywhere really but the grass
you already know that thing about the grass and there is
nothing in my flat that is greener than the plants
in fact there is nothing green in my flat except the plants
so I apply for this job and that job and it's just like dating
as a man because it's a numbers game really
the more jobs you apply for the more chances you have
to have sex and fall in love and go out to eat at a restaurant
while you are sharing about the boring menial shit
that goes on at your tech company every day and meetings
are the worst aren't they? but it is nice to have wine
with someone so I get my CV all spruced up and dripping
with morsels that will catch the eye of some HR recruiter
rifling through applications and I make sure to run it
through the AI brush up machine nowadays just to give it
that extra sparkle as it sits on a virtual desk in a virtual office
somewhere in virtually twenty twenty six just a bit ahead
and then I write a stupid diary of a programmer poem.

title: An Earthquake During Surgery
content:
I must make the most precise cuts
as the floor is shaking and the table as well
but this just the nature of my job and the planet
in twenty twenty five that we must work
in the midst of the turbulence and trembling
attempting to match the rhythm of the hand
with jerks and jolts of quaking walls
just to make a six millimeter long incision
in the inner lining of the right ventricle in the heart
that is pulsating unusually also with matching tremors.
these are unheard of conditions and yet
there is what is ideal which includes a room
that does not move at all and there is what is
occurring now which is the violent humming
chamber in which all of us operators are
attempting to patch a life up so that it exists
for at least another ten to twenty years
and I can say this is one of those nightmares
I had when I was in med school so long ago
where I woke up at four in the morning
next to my partner who also woke up
as I sat up like a lightning bolt and told her
that I had just had a horrible dream
where I was performing a ventriculotomy
on her heart and all of a sudden the ground
started shaking and my feet started sliding around
and I had to finish the surgery in the midst
of an earthquake before she died.

title: I'm Horny AF and you are in New York
content:
sleeping because when it's ten o'clock here
it's four in the morning there and you are the kind
of woman who like to sleep at night but my dick
keeps rising up like a tidal wave and I want
to push it through the hole between your legs
so I try and try and try to extend it like a rubber
band all the way across the Atlantic even though
the tip of it won't even graze the window of my flat
if only it would bloom like a safflower or snap
as the elastic became too taut then at least
I could finally get some writing done.

title: Love in the Zone of Time Warps 02
content:
it is raining so I came out on the balcony in Berlin
to write this poem in the dark while you were meeting
in the middle of the afternoon with your colleagues
in New York regarding the stock and I shuttered
when I tried to feel you all the way across the Atlantic
because it is one thing when you are across town
in Pankow and it is another now that our feet
are touching non-contiguous ground and it almost feels
like we are two nodes whose transmission lines
have been interrupted. but then the lightning flashed
and a low thunder rumbled on the horizon
and the rain moved on to a different street
to a different balcony where two lovers were making
out with their mouths instead of their phones

and I went to sleep imagining you six hours later
going to sleep and two hours later waking up
and six hours later after you waking up
and how we eat lunch separately and drink
coffee at different times and how after two weeks
it's going to feel like I am a boat and you are a car
as we begin to transform ourselves without even trying
just purely by accident of environment and money
that is worth different amounts and bagels oh god
the bagels are going to tear us apart and turn us
into strangers with enough time warping our minds
apart. at least with time though there is a beginning

and an end and we know that this twilight zone gapping
us will eventually end so we can get back to both being
awake and drinking coffee after a long night of fire
and sex and melting together in the exact same room.

title: Love in the Zone of Time Warps
content:
let's see if you can stretch you heart
across the Atlantic ocean to me
and I will stretch mine as well
as far as the rubber band can go
so we can make the best of this
six hour overlap of sunlight
when we can both look at the same sky
as we're both on Earth together
sharing some common ground
even if it's non-contiguous.

title: an Idiot With a Coat of Arms (címeres bolond)
content:
I wanted to take a picture for you so I took my dick and tried
to thread it through the stems of the bouquet of bloody
golden safflowers you gave me but it was not a soft slide,
rather a spiky thwarting and I ended up just laying
the shaft on top of the thistle like blooms, snapping
a pic and sending it to you.
monogamous relationships are upside down
you say and inside out and all twisted up and spiky
but at least when I tie you up in my ropes you don't feel
trapped but instead like the rest of the perverted world
has disappeared for a little while and you can slip
the stress of having to take care of everyone else
and then it's a bit like the ceiling has become the floor.
    you'll have to forgive me because I feel royal
in my idiocy and I feel idiotic sipping tea in the morning
instead of coffee, the basket of eggs that I am filling–
it's not certain whether there are yolks in any of them yet
I go on wearing the face of an adult who just wants to play
with your pussy all night long and never go out again
to make the rounds and perform the perfunctory duties
the duke of pooping must with a salad fork and crown.

title: Diary of a Programmer 50: My Second Head
content:
very quickly in twenty twenty five I have grown
a second head. it takes me a quarter of the time
to do the tasks that I did last year. I can outsource
thinking and processing and performance
of rudimentary and menial activities
and I don't have to think too hard about complex
things that don't make sense to me. no, instead
I just ask my other head and it gives me answers
or simplifies complex ideas or clarifies something
that was before incomprehensible. it's like having a dog
who can suddenly talk and listen, with whom I converse
with over dinner and it's like my day is now filled with space
that wasn't there before in which I can write stupid
poems about being a programmer with two heads
like a verbose conjoined twin of which everyone is afraid of
dying at an early age if I keep up this mutant level of production.
but I have to tell you that instead of feeling like a freak
when I walk down the street in the middle of a weekday
with my second head in order to grab lunch at the market
I am starting to see everyone else has grown another neck
as well as an invisible head. you can really see it
in the glossy eyes of the first head as they roll back
while allocating some certain amount of memory and processing
power to this brand spanking new twin thinking machine
that is so the latest trend but more than that the future.

title: Diary of a Programmer 49: Email of the 1960s
content:
Dear Reader,

This is an email from the 1960s. There are no hyperlinks
on which you can click, no. You must merely use your eyes
and not your hand to scan through each line of the document.
I can only imagine what you will have time to do with your hands
in the meantime. I imagine you are sitting at a cold metal desk
with an actual, physical, made-out-of-metal-and-not-plastic inbox
tray sitting atop it, probably and hopefully labelled by Dymo.
If you have an inbox then I would also assume it is the top shelf
of a double decker tray system and that beneath the inbox
is an outbox, which in the best cases gets picked up and collected
once or twice a day if the mail person or a secretary or whoever
takes care of inbox/outbox pickup and deliveries is not sick
and is doing a punctual and perfunctory performance of their duties.
I wouldn't imagine there are any images on the papers that arrive
in the inbox either just the same as this very email you are reading
unless they were developed and glued upon the page or drawn
by hand or if your company is really living in the future printed one
by one of those printers with paper that has punch holes on the sides
and makes that jerky and exotic noise that sounds like a buzzing
electronic bee needling the parchment with ink and the coolness
of the hip young generation of new presses that is causing a stir
in the newspaper industry. Yes, as you read the words on this page
try to imagine a world in which you will go through hundreds
if not thousands of these emails per day, perhaps with the help
of an automated, electronic set of eyes that instantly takes junk papers
out of the inbox, wads them up, and tosses them in the rubbish bin
just to the left of your desk that weighs about the same as a baby
elephant. Of course you can't. Even though you have the concentration
to be able to read all the way through this email without looking
out the window of your office in Manhattan, at the traffic, ants
skittering back and forth down the boulevard not fifteen floors below
I bet you do not even savour the space and time you are disconnected
from the complicated virtual webs and clouds of the future
that will eventually pollute the air invisibly and take your attention
and turn it into a product and take your mind and mine it for data
and generally just begin to turn the tables so that you are not
as human feeling as you once felt when you woke up in the morning
in the woods at the weekend when the sun rose and punched
its rays through the mesh door of your tent where you had lain
listening to a rushing river all night, a river from which you could drink
straight out of. Hell, I bet your thoughts are even able to stay
on track like that river inside your head at night enough so
to make it all the way through the Sun Also Rises or Tender Buttons
without reaching into your pocket to check again and again
the miniature inbox, which would reduce the number of pages
you read per night from fifty to ten, and limit conversations with family
at night around the fire but my god you will be talking with Russia
and thinking about catastrophes in Kuala Lumpur and flirting
with someone who you don't even know is real. But for shame,
we have come to the end of this email and all I ask of you, really,
is to take a pen and mark your signature on the back of this page,
then slide it in the bottom shelf of your task shelf and call it
one completed task for the day that makes money for who knows why.

With friendly regards,

Future Email

title: The Inside-Out Communication Paradox
content:
my stomach sinks when you tell me about the good times
you are having with the family of your husband
but when you mention there is a disconnect between you and him
in the morning when you tried to have sex
    well the stars explode like fireworks
and I know this is twisted tied up backwards and inside out
    because fucking hell I should be happy for your happiness
    and sad for your sadness
but it's just the opposite and it's the exact same for you
when I go out on a date and have a good time with some cutie
your stomach sinks and you feel left out and it is just shit
but when I get knocked down and what should have panned out doesn't
then you make the trip halfway across the city to hold my hand
as we walk down a long path next to the water lined with boats and ducks
    and that is not to say the stars are exploding because they aren't
    it's just that it's nice to be there and to feel like you can serve
    a comforting purpose in your partner's life
but doesn't this perverted relationship make perfect sense
for us sickos? I can't imagine a more perfect relationship
than one where I tie you up and you feel free
where I force you upon your knees and you feel loved
where you let me become a wild animal and I feel like a boy
giving myself to someone who doesn't even want me
which is exactly how I painted love as a kid– with light
that was blacker than darkness, with sweetness
that was more bitter and smokey than a cheap mezcal

title: Diary of a Programmer 48: Mechanics are just Walking Around the City Willy Nilly
content:
just the other day I was sure I saw one. with his paws black with grease
but he wasn't wearing a blue or gray or denim onesie as he stood there
on the corner checking his black mirror for directions or dates or reading
texts from his girlfriend who was definitely not complaining about her car no
he was wearing a burgundy corduroy jacket and parachute pants with wire
framed glasses but I knew yes I was sure he was a mechanic because I swear
I've seen one before even though I don't own a car and I take so many trains
all through the day and night but I could tell by the smudges on the sides
of his palms he had been working in the shop all day wrenching this and that
listening to different engines whir and hum and rattle and click and jerk
and jump as if he was tuning into Spotify premium without advertisements
I couldn't believe it I thought it was nineteen ninety five and I was at the zoo
watching a leopard donning the coat of a giraffe milling about but nonetheless
I was certain it was twenty twenty five and I was sitting there flat
whiting at the cafe as the Insta feed dribbled out onto my chin
as I baked my brand into a monkey patched marketable profile
hoping that someone anyone everyone would stop by and throw a like
or use their bloody unused mouth to simply say hello

title: Diary of a Programmer 47: Here's an Engine, Now Fix the Bug
content:
in order to understand an engine, one must be an engineer
or a mechanic. you can be a mechanic and understand an engine.
can you imagine being a mechanic and getting a shoddy engine delivered
in nineteen ninety one? and then your boss tells you to find the bug.
so you stand there listening to the muttering of the engine as it sort of runs
with clicks and whines and jerks and jolts, trying to suss out the problem.

title: A Double Padel Day Without Winning and You
content:
I can't imagine myself as a ghost
writer but my uncle and his wife fancy their selves
published authors now and instead of a call on Sunday
asking me how my day/week/life is going I got a message
with the contents of a LinkedIn promotion
promoting their new book which is shifting the paradigm
or part of the paradigm shift series.

title: I Can't Remember the Last Time I Pet a Dog
content:
but there is a sweet one laying in front of me
now in the Passenger cafe and I kind of want to
paint you as the bitch that you are but my heart
was just sinking when I listened to your message
about being slapped in the face by NYC and the hotness
of all the broads and the thick consumerist spirit
and the disconnected sex and the tears over father
and these brutally honest things that arise when
you are tipsy about feeling left out and wanting
to fuck someone else but when the dog leaves
I am still writing this poem and thinking about you
and how I love that I can take you and do with you
exactly what I want and you won't complain
and how much this makes my dick grow bigger
than with anyone else and even though I went out
with someone who doesn't like anything you like
and I like that, it only makes me miss you more
than all the stupid hoes in short skirts fashioning
their way through the overpriced streets of Brooklyn
because the way you come over and wag your butt
for me and then way I take my hands and pet
your breasts like an ape and all the other little things
that make it so special between us are irreplaceable.
